agents.name: agent-a
agents.lastMessage:
Completed in scope `tasks-frontend/bootstrap`.

Implemented explicit single-route bootstrapping so the `Tasks` page is the default and only destination:

- `tasks-frontend/bootstrap/src/App.tsx`: changed routing to:

  - Render `TasksPage` at `/`
  - Catch all other paths and redirect to `/` via `Navigate` (prevents any additional accessible routes)

This keeps the entrypoint/root mount as-is (`tasks-frontend/bootstrap/src/main.tsx` mounting `#root` with `App`) and uses the existing `react-router-dom` dependency already declared in `tasks-frontend/bootstrap/package.json`.

agents.name: agent-b
agents.lastMessage:
Implemented inside scope `tasks-frontend/pages` only.

Changes made:
- Added `tasks-frontend/pages/index.html`

What it includes:
- One-page page-level layout with header + two-column shell (control panel + task board)
- Task form controls for “Create task” placeholders (title, priority, assignee, notes, buttons, helper text)
- “View” placeholders (search/filter area placeholder and view mode buttons placeholders)
- Static task sections with three columns: `Backlog`, `In progress`, `Done`, each populated with static cards
- Responsive behavior for smaller screens

No additional files were modified.

agents.name: agent-c
agents.lastMessage:
Implemented.

I added a new reusable component-based Tasks page entirely under `tasks-frontend/components`:

- `tasks-frontend/components/section-header.js`
- `tasks-frontend/components/action-buttons.js`
- `tasks-frontend/components/task-row.js`
- `tasks-frontend/components/task-list.js`
- `tasks-frontend/components/tasks-page.js`
- `tasks-frontend/components/tasks-page.css`
- `tasks-frontend/components/tasks-page.html`

What’s now included:
- Reusable `section-header` component for section titles/subtitles.
- Reusable `action-buttons` component with dispatching `task-action` events (`complete`, `edit`, `delete`).
- Reusable `task-row` component for rendering each task with metadata and actions.
- Reusable `task-list` component that renders multiple `task-row` items and updates on state changes.
- `tasks-page.html` composes the above into a working Tasks page with two sections.
- `tasks-page.js` wires interactions (toggle complete, rename via prompt, delete, section counts).

To run:
- Open `tasks-frontend/components/tasks-page.html` in a browser.

agents.name: agent-d
agents.lastMessage:
Implemented in-scope change:

- Added `tasks-frontend/styles/tasks-page.css`

What it includes:
- Baseline visual system with CSS variables, typography, spacing, borders, gradients, and card surfaces.
- Card/list layout classes (`.tasks-card`, `.tasks-list`, `.tasks-column`, `.tasks-board`) for task board style.
- Table-like layout classes (`.tasks-table-shell`, `.tasks-table`, `.tasks-table th/td`) for tabular task views.
- Form/control styling (`.tasks-input`, `.tasks-select`, `.tasks-textarea`, `.tasks-button*`) and placeholder/support sections.
- Responsive behavior:
  - Two-column → single-column layout at `max-width: 980px`
  - Compact top bar, stacked controls/actions, and mobile-friendly table row-to-card transformation at `max-width: 600px`

I did not modify files outside `tasks-frontend/styles`.  
If you want, I can also update the page markup to use these class names and hook the stylesheet in directly.
